document_data.name: Sildar Hallwinter
document_data.mainbody: '''Sildar Hallwinter''' was a retired knight from [[Neverwinter]] and later a member of the [[Town Council of Phandalin]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Description: Sildar was nearly 50 years old in [[1491 DR]].{{Phandelver-time}}
document_data.Personality: Despite his restrained and almost cold mannerisms and speech, Sildar was kind-hearted{{Cite adventurers league/In Volo's Wake|6}} and sincere, although lacking in confidence and charisma. He wished to see the town of Phandalin prosper and to ensure that innocents—even fools—never came to any harm.
document_data.Activities: As a citizen and later town councilor of [[Phandalin]], Sildar's role was to ensure the safety of the town's mining and timber operations, and to see to it that nothing interfered with them. In this way, he strove to help elevate Phandalin to a position of relevance in the region's trade and commerce.
document_data.History:
Sildar originally hailed from Neverwinter. In his younger days, Sildar was a soldier and earned himself a place of honor among the [[Griffon Cavalry]] of Waterdeep.

As of the {{YearlinkName|1491}}, Sildar was working as a sellsword.

Following his rescue from the Cragmaws by [[adventurer]]s, Sildar's confidence in himself was badly shaken, and he retired from his martial lifestyle in Phandalin. Despite his lack of confidence, he continued to stay in shape and quickly became respected within the community as an honorable and brave man. When Phandalin formed a town council not long after his retirement had started, he was elected as one of the three councilors.

Early in his tenure as councilor, his adopted daughter Alana disappeared into the [[Crooked Forest]]. Unable to go after her for fear that his disappearance would cause anxiety in Phandalin, he hired adventurers to find her and to return with her discretely.

In the {{YearlinkName|1496}},{{AI-time}} Sildar campaigned against Harbin Wester in Phandalin's first mayoral election. He was generally lacking in the swagger and oratory ability expected of an aspiring politician, but was motivated to push against Harbin's corrupt and self-serving agenda.
